page.title: 10A CARLISLE SUBURB;MEMORIES
page.content: With a penny you could buy 4 sweets.If you had sixpence you were rich.Behind the shop were some cows and hens. People weren't rich,but they got plenty to eat.There was plenty of market gardens and orchards,so there was plenty of fruit and vegetables. Gas lamps weren't introduced until about 1928.Houses were dark and were lit by candlelight or paraffin lamps. Few people had a wireless and tele- vision was not invented.People sailed boats,fished and paddled in the stream at Beck Road.Houses were unlocked be- cause nobody stole anything and every- body knew everybody.Acredale was the end of Belle Vue.Green Lane was just trees.Beaver Road,Crown Road,Beck Road and Criffel Road had very few houses and were just lanes with an archway of trees over them.Games were Mutterkitty Hopscotch,Hide'n'seek and Top'n'whip.
